Pacman.lib
Class Vector

java.lang.Object
  Pacman.lib.Vector
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Vector
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Two dimensional vector This class can be used to store absolute positions and relative motion.

See Also:

getDirection

public Direction getDirection()
Returns:
The direction in which the vector points. Returns null when vector is not normed or not parallel to X- or Y-axis.

constrainToMap

public Vector constrainToMap()
If this vector represents a point outside the map, it wraps around. So if a moving object leaves the map, it will appear again on the opposite site of the map.

Returns:
The resulting vector to the new position.

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
Compares the vector with an Object.

Overrides:
equals in class java.lang.Object
Parameters:
obj - Object to compare the vector with
Returns:
true if obj is a Vector with same x and y values like this vector
